ratings.comment: Isn't very clear in her lectures but the material is easy anyway. Doesn't put in the extra effort to help, relegates most of the work she should do to her TA's who are clueless

Her exam was ridiculously hard. Don't need to read but make sure you literally memorize every single site and thing she talks about because it will be on the exam. Other than that I did like her as person and she was super nice when I went in for office hours.

For her first year teaching, I thought she did very well. She was clear by having an outline at the beginning of her lectures and a summary at the end. Test was definitely hard - make sure you know all of your sites.  Of the 3 teachers that taught the sections, she was my favorite. Very nice and helpful if you go into office hours.

Don't bother going to lecture because she speeds through them way too fast to take notes on. Just get her power points online later and study them. Make sure you really memorize all the specific sites on her power point slides because those are a huge part of the test.
She speeds through her lectures to the point of it not even being possible to fully take notes. The test is very specific and way too hard for a 100 level class. Would not recommend this class.
Be ready to rote memorize site names for Anthro 100.

She speeds through her lecture slides to the point where it is useless to try to take notes. Her exam was very focused on very specific details. Felt like I did well on the exam but she definitely expects way to much for a 100 level class that can only be taken by students not majoring in anthropology. Would avoid if possible, take anthro 104.

She is great in office hours and does a great job about clarifying the material. Her lectures are very clear and not too fast. She is clearly passionate about teaching her subject. I would take a class from her again.

She was very accommodating when students wanted to meet outside of office hours, but she went so fast through her PowerPoints that many gave up on taking notes, opting to do them later when the slides were posted online. The test was difficult and relied on tiny details regarding sites that we had barely talked about in class. Reading is essential.

This was her first time teaching and she did a really good job. Her section of archaeology was kind of interesting but she makes it more interesting. She goes very fast during power points and the slides are very vague.
